Static certification tests can only cover a finite spectrum of the technical gamut that is Perl. CPAN and rt.cpan.org participation demonstrate technical prowess and also soft skills, such as project management and ability to work in a remote team setting. These cannot possibly be assessed by a certification but are at least as important for employers as the technical skills a certification would cover. These arguments are equally applicable to any sort of (technical) certification, but few languages provide a centralized, well-established proving ground for developers to exercise their soft skills simultaneously (with the added benefit that the product of such is usable code).
